STRONG
TO SERVE

The School we love the most

School
Prayer

Have in Thy Keeping, O Lord, Our God, This School, That Its work May be Thorough And its life Joyful. That from it may Go Out, Strong in body mind and Character, Men who in thy name and power, will serve their fellows faithfully, Through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

School Anthem

Lord while for all mankind we pray,
Of every Clime and coast,
Oh hear us for our native school,
The school we love the most x3

OUR MISSION

To graduate students who are strong in body, mind and character, to serve their fellows faithfully in Africa and beyond.

WHO we are

BRIEF HISTORY OF THE SCHOOL

Alliance High School is a top national school in Kenya offering 8.4.4. curriculum started in 1926 by the Alliance of Protestant Churches – The Church of Scotland Mission (later known as the Presbyterian Church of East Africa or PCEA), Church of the Province of Kenya (CPK) (later known as the Anglican Church of Kenya), African Inland Church (AIC), the Friends Church (Quakers) and the Methodist Church.  The school was one of the first schools in Kenya to offer secondary school education to Africans. It is located approximately 22 kilometres from the Capital city, Nairobi, 10-minute walk from the Alliance Girls’ High School, the sister school started later in 1948 and about 2km from Kikuyu town.

MORE

academic exellence

The School has established itself as an academic Giant since the start of 8-4-4. It has remained at the top since

Board of management

The board led by the Chair Sam Ncheeri is the backbone of the school administration.

THE PTA

Parents Association led by Prof. Gideon Maina Vice Chancellor,  Pioneer University brings together parents of the school

STUDENTS

The school has students who have excelled from various primary schools across the country

FORM 1 ADMISSION

Who is admitted in form 1

Being a public school, the students are allocated to the school by the Ministry of Education through Merit and Choice. 

A student has to choose the school at his primary candidate class and has to achieve he required score.

Learn More
societies & CLUBS at ahs
ACTIVITIES OUTSIDE THE ACADEMICS THAT STUDENTS ARE INVOLVED IN

ICT CLUB

Brings together students who have shown interest in computers are guided to understand it even better.

ST. JOHN'S AMBULANCE

This society trains to save a life at all times especially the first critical minutes before medics arrive

MODEL UNITED NATIONS

Students are taught to understand current affairs, the  people and the world

INTERACT CLUB

The students are enlightened on interactions and discuss matters concerning them day to day

AVIATION CLUB

Students interested in aviation are given required resources to prepare them for a career in aviation

ROBOTICS CLUB

Students with interest in robotics are given pre-requisite resources and exposure to careers in robotics

alls clubs and Socieities

The school activities as per the school calendar for term 2 2023

all events
Carey francis

SCHOOL ROUTINE

The school routine is overseen by the teacher; boarding master routine currently under Mr. Akweya. The routine defines the day to activities that include academics, cleanups, chapel, food, assembly and all

more
OBC

OLD BOYS

The Old boys are integral part of the school. The Old Boys Club consists of students and staff who have previously served the school at various capacities.  They play a key role of supporting the school in it’s programmes

more
SCOUTS

WHY BUSH

“Bush” is a place where all students graduating from primary to secondary admire. First it was started to educate Africa child since non existed prior. Secondly is it’s culture that has developed over the years that is unique and admirable. Then follows the character of the students that’s outstanding

more

the school chapel

the school is in the process of building a chapel

Being a christian founded school, the chapel is one of critical school features where students are spiritually nourished. Learn More..

bush in pictorial

THE SCHOOL WE LOVE THE MOST
The school admits Bright students who have excelled from across the country. Over 60% of these students are unablel to make meet their fees obligations. You can participate by sponsoring a student through paying his fees, buying for him usables, shopping or fair back home. you want to Support a Student?

UPCOMING ACTIVITIES

want to know what to happen next?

Annaul General Meeting (AGM) brings together students, parents and administration to assess the school progress and recommend ways to improve even much better. This meeting is happening on Saturday 15 April 2023 starting 8am in the school upper field
